repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits.

handNote.p: Tamil script. One hand only. 4 to 5 lines per page.

binding.p: Woodcovers (pinewood) apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Before 1855, as it is part of Ariel’s bequest made in that year to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1869).

acquisition.p: Bequest of Edouard Ariel. Made first to Société Asiatique de Paris in 1855, later transfered to Bibliothèque Nationale (see Rosny 1869).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 14.
Rosny, Léon de (1869). La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
Vinson, Julien (1867‒1868). Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls. Corrected proofreadings printed by the atelier oriental del’Imprimerie nationale. Access No. 4-IMPROR-77 (B). — See p. 21.

revisionDesc.change: This catalogue entry has been redacted by Emmanuel FRANCIS (CNRS, CEIAS UMR 8564, EHESS/CNRS) for the research program Texts Surrounding Texts (TST, FRAL 2018, ANR/DFG). Version 1, July 2020.

body.p: The bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains between the two woodcovers:
U1: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page by hand n° 1. With shelfmark: C/37.
U2a: 1 folio, unfoliated = instruction to user, benediction, title.
U2b: 1 folio, unfoliated = title, instruction to user, benediction.
U2c: 14 folios, Tamil foliation 1–14 = Kēṭariyammaṉ Viratam, mūlam.
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions; instructions tousers; titles; title-page.

U1, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = title-page: marginal benediction, title.
(f[1]r, lm) veṟṟivēl uṟṟa tuṇai
(f[1]r, c1, 1) Iḵtu C/37
(f[1]r, c2, 1–2) kētārinātar viratam

U2a, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = instruction to user, benediction, title.
(f[1]r, c1, 1–2) y-itu vāt=tiyār cuvaṭi
(f[1]r, c2, 1–3) y-itu yārum aṟiyav° [i.e. aṟiyavum]
(f[1]r, c3, 1) kētāriya-sthāṉa-
(f[1]r, c3, 2) ṉōṉpu-y eṭuttavar-
(f[1]r, c3, 3) kaḷ koṭuppatu {pcs} civa-
(f[1]r, c3, 4) mayam v-uṇṭ-āka vēṇ-
(f[1]r, c4, 1) ṭiyatu {pcl}
(f[1]r, c4, 2) vāṇi namastu {pcl}
(f[1]r, c5, 1–2) kēṭariyamma[ṉ] virata-c cuṭi [i.e. cuvaṭi?]

U2b, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = title, instruction to user, benediction.
(f[1]r, c1, 1) kēṭariyammaṉ
(f[1]r, c1, 2) virutam {pcs} y-itu ṉō-
(f[1]r, c1, 3) ṉpu cevaṭi [i.e. cuvaṭi?]
(f[1]r, c2, 1) y-itu-y eṭuttavarkaḷ
(f[1]r, c2, 2) vācit=tu-p pāt=tu-k koṭu-
(f[1]r, c2, 3) ppatu {pcs} y-itu vāt=tiyār cu-
(f[1]r, c2, 4) vaṭi {pcs} vāṇi namastu {pcs}

U2c, folio 1, recto, = incipit, mūlam: marginal benedicitions; instruction to user; incipit.
(f1r, lm, 1) hari Om
(f1r, lm, 2) naṉṟāka
(f1r, lm, 3) kuru vāḻka
(f1r, lm, 4) kuruvē tuṇai
(f1r, c1, 1) kētāriyammaṉ
(f1r, c1, 2) ṉōṉpu virutam
(f1r, c1, 3) y-itu yāvarum aṟi-
(f1r, c1, 4) ya vēṇṭiyatu {pcl}
(f1r1) śrī-kāyilācattilē paramēsparaṉum pāravatiyammaṉum ṟattiṉa-cimmacaṉattiṉ peri-
(f1r2) lē (...)

Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Lacuna of unknown extent: [...].Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} =piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}.Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
